qas.question: What was the new currency in Bermuda as of 1970?
The Bermudian dollar is equal to what other currency and can be used interchangeably?
Who is pictured on Bermudian dollars?
Who regulates all financial institutions as well as the issuing of money?
Where can you see a permanent exhibition of Bermuda currency?
What did the country switch in 1907?
What currency did Bermuda switch to in 1907?
Who do the US notes carry the image of?
What does the Naval Dockyard Royal Museum hold a permanent collection of?

context: In 1970 the country switched its <b5_0>currency<b5_0/> from the Bermudian pound to the <a0_0><b6_0>Bermudian dollar<b6_0/><a0_0/>, which is pegged at par with the <a1_0>US dollar<a1_0/>. US notes and coins are used interchangeably with Bermudian notes and coins within the islands for most practical purposes; however, banks levy an exchange rate fee for the purchase of US dollars with Bermudian dollars. Bermudian notes carry the image of <a2_0><b7_0>Queen Elizabeth II<b7_0/>.<a2_0/> The <a3_0>Bermuda Monetary Authority<a3_0/> is the issuing authority for all banknotes and coins, and regulates financial institutions. The <a4_0>Royal Naval Dockyard Museum<a4_0/> holds a permanent exhibition of <b8_0>Bermuda notes and coins<b8_0/>.
